spanishExample: Les bastó un taxi.
englishTranslation: One taxi did the trick for them.
vocabIncluded: bastó: was enough, he/she/it was enough (Bastar, preterite, 3rd person)
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Diles que toquen la guitarra frente a millones de personas.
englishTranslation: Tell them to play guitar in front of millions of people.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
toquen: touch/play, they touch/play (Tocar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Nos encantaba ir de vacaciones.
englishTranslation: We loved going on vacation.
vocabIncluded: encantaba: enchanted, he/she/it enchanted (Encantar, imperfect, 3rd person)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: Le dolió la cabeza, así que tomó un taxi.
englishTranslation: His head hurt, so he took a taxi.
vocabIncluded: dolió: hurt, he/she/it hurt (Doler, preterite, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
tomó: took, he/she/it took (Tomar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Andar en tren bastaría para no tener tráfico.
englishTranslation: Going by train would do the trick to not have traffic.
vocabIncluded: andar: to walk / to go/get along (Andar infinitive)
bastaría: would be enough, he/she/it would be enough (Bastar, conditional, 3rd person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Le duele el brazo; no lo toques.
englishTranslation: His arm hurts; don’t touch it.
vocabIncluded: duele: hurts, he/she/it hurts (Doler, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Él es el dueño de veintisiete mil dólares.
englishTranslation: He is the owner of twenty-seven thousand dollars.

spanishExample: A su jefe no le gusta como suenan esas canciones.
englishTranslation: His boss doesn’t like how those songs sound.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
suenan: sound, they sound (Sonar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: El detective dijo que una cosa basta para el caso.
englishTranslation: The detective said that one thing does the trick for the case.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
basta: is enough, he/she/it is enough (Bastar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Les encantarían esos autobuses si no hubiera tráfico.
englishTranslation: They would love those buses if there weren’t traffic.
vocabIncluded: encantarían: would enchant, they would enchant (Encantar, conditional, 3rd person plural)
hubiera: "there were to be" (Haber, past subjunctive, impersonal)
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Su papel como capitán del vuelo era importante.
englishTranslation: His role as captain of the flight was important.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: A su abogado le encantará que no sea tan honesta.
englishTranslation: Her lawyer will love that she isn’t so honest.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
encantará: will enchant, he/she/it will enchant (Encantar, future, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
tan: "so" as an adverb right before an adjective or adverb

spanishExample: El sargento le dijo al soldado que esto bastará.
englishTranslation: The sergeant told the soldier that this will suffice.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun
bastará: will be enough, he/she/it will be enough (Bastar, future, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Mi primo tiene una guitarra y un piano.
englishTranslation: My cousin has a guitar and a piano.

spanishExample: Su primo estaba ahí, esperando el autobús.
englishTranslation: Her cousin was there, waiting for the bus.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener

spanishExample: Ese dinero no bastaba; necesitábamos seiscientos sesenta y un mil pesos.
englishTranslation: That money wasn’t enough; we needed six hundred and sixty-one thousand pesos.
vocabIncluded: bastaba: was enough, he/she/it was enough (Bastar, imperfect, 3rd person)
necesitábamos: needed, we needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person plural)
peso: weight/peso as in currency (masc. noun)

spanishExample: Su teléfono sonaba todas las mañanas.
englishTranslation: Her phone rang every morning.
vocabIncluded: sonaba: sounded, he/she/it sounded (Sonar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Han bastado novecientos veinticuatro millones.
englishTranslation: Nine hundred and twenty four million have done the trick.
vocabIncluded: han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No te toca; te diré cuando te toque.
englishTranslation: It isn’t your turn; I’ll tell you when it’s your turn.
vocabIncluded: diré: "will say", "I will say" (Decir, future, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
toca: touches/plays, he/she/it  touches/plays (Tocar, present, 3rd person)
toque: touch/play, he/she/it touch/play (Tocar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Bastaban siete mil dólares para tener nuestras vacaciones.
englishTranslation: Seven thousand dollars did the trick to have our vacation.
vocabIncluded: bastaban: were enough, they were enough (Bastar, imperfect, 3rd person plural)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: El teléfono de tu compañera de trabajo podría sonar.
englishTranslation: Your coworker’s(f) phone could ring.
vocabIncluded: podría: "would be able", "he/she/it would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Bastan tres horas para ir al aeropuerto.
englishTranslation: Three hours suffice for going to the airport.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
bastan: are enough, they are enough (Bastar, present, 3rd person plural)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Esto te dolerá, así que te encantaría no hacerlo.
englishTranslation: This will hurt you, so you would love not doing it.
vocabIncluded: dolerá: will hurt, he/she/it will hurt (Doler, future, 3rd person)
encantaría: would enchant, he/she/it would enchant (Encantar, conditional, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Ha estado tocando el piano por horas y me encanta.
englishTranslation: She has been playing the piano for hours and I love it.
vocabIncluded: encanta: enchants, he/she/it enchants (Encantar, present, 3rd person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Si tocas eso, te va a doler la mano.
englishTranslation: If you touch that, your hand is going to hurt you.
vocabIncluded: te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
tocas: touch/play, you  touch/play (Tocar, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¡No toquen la guitarra! Está sonando extraño.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Don’t play the guitar! It’s sounding strange.

spanishExample: La capitana era honesta y le encantaban esas cosas.
englishTranslation: The captain(f) was honest and she loved those things.
vocabIncluded: encantaban: enchanted, they enchanted (Encantar, imperfect, 3rd person plural)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Su teléfono sonó miles de veces.
englishTranslation: His phone rang thousands of times.
vocabIncluded: sonó: sounded, he/she/it sounded (Sonar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Su jefa no sabe que les encantan esas cosas.
englishTranslation: Their boss(f) doesn’t know they love those things.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
encantan: enchant, they enchant (Encantar, present, 3rd person plural)
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: No quiero que le duela el corazón.
englishTranslation: I don’t want her heart to hurt her.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
duela: hurt, he/she/it hurt (Doler, subjunctive, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Tocó la guitarra, pero no había tocado en un tiempo.
englishTranslation: She played the guitar, but she hadn’t played in a while.
vocabIncluded: había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
tocó: touched/played, he/she/it touched/played (Tocar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No puedes tocar ese carro; vale cinco millones de dólares.
englishTranslation: You can’t touch that car; it’s worth five million dollars.
vocabIncluded: vale: is worth, he/she/it is worth (Valer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La soldado dice que la música en el aeropuerto suena bien.
englishTranslation: The soldier(f) says that the music at the airport sounds good.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
suena: sounds, he/she/it sounds (Sonar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tu carro vale tres mil cuatrocientos ochenta dólares.
englishTranslation: Your car is worth three thousand four hundred and eighty dollars.
vocabIncluded: peso: weight/peso as in currency (masc. noun)
vale: is worth, he/she/it is worth (Valer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: El papel de nuestro compañero es muy importante para nosotros, él es detective.
englishTranslation: The role of my coworker is very important for us, he is a detective.

spanishExample: Si toco esta canción, tienes que darme cuarenta y cinco millones de pesos.
englishTranslation: If I play this song, you have to give me forty-five million pesos.
vocabIncluded: peso: weight/peso as in currency (masc. noun)
toco: touch/play, I touch/play(Tocar, present, 1st person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Aunque suene loco, creo que tres millones pueden no bastar.
englishTranslation: Even if it sounds crazy, I think three million might not suffice.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
suene: sound, he/she/it sound (Sonar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No quiere que toque su carro.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t want me to touch his car.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
toque: touch/play, I touch/play (Tocar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Toca algo para ella; le va a encantar.
englishTranslation: Play something for her; she is going to love it.
vocabIncluded: le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Siempre le ha encantado estar aquí, pasando tiempo con nosotros.
englishTranslation: She has always loved being here, spending time with us.
vocabIncluded: advanced: use of a gerund as an adverb, not right after a conjugated verb
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Suenas como tu mamá que es abogada.
englishTranslation: You sound like your mom who is a lawyer.
vocabIncluded: suenas: sound, you sound (Sonar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Necesito un millón trescientos mil.
englishTranslation: I need one million three hundred thousand.
vocabIncluded: necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡No toque eso! Nos encantó así.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Don’t touch that! We loved it like this.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
encantó: enchanted, he/she/it enchanted (Encantar, preterite, 3rd person)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")

spanishExample: El sargento es el dueño de esta arma, ¡no la toques!
englishTranslation: The sergeant is the owner of this gun, don’t touch it!

spanishExample: Nuestro vuelo salió tarde.
englishTranslation: Our flight left late.
vocabIncluded: salió: went out, he/she/it went out (Salir, preterite, 3rd person)
